8 Classic Childrens Books

The Tale of Peter Rabbit

Beatrix Potter

Beatrix Potter’s classic children’s book with lovely illustrations make this little rabbit a mainstay of children’s literature over a hundred years later. In the first of many tales, mischievous Peter runs into danger when he disobeys his mother and ventures into the neighbor’s garden. A story about consequences, the playful tale is never scary and ranks at number two on Publishers Weekly‘s list of all-time bestselling children’s books. It’s amazing that it’s one of the iconic books that almost didn’t get published.

  • Audience:8-12 years
  • First published:1952
  • Pages:256
  • Publisher:Square fish
